input_text:
Job Title: Continuous Improvements Logistics Analyst

Location: Greensboro, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, TEKsystems c/o Allegis Group, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Description:

Do you enjoy driving very complex projects while seeking to invent and simplify? Do you enjoy leveraging your creativity to build solutions to real world problems? The Logistics division is looking for energetic talent for its Data & Analytics Team. The ideal candidate is passionate about new ideas, works effectively with cross-functional teams and thrives in a fast-paced setting that is constantly evolving. We dive deep on a broad range of subjects, but we are adaptable and action oriented. We focus on quickly gaining enough context to enable informed decision-making. Executing strategic projects that evolve the core of our operations in line with the overall business strategies is our primary objective.

You will focus on driving analytical capabilities for the logistics organization that affect distribution, transportation, and inventory. The position requires an understanding of wholesale, retail and direct-to-consumer business functions. This person will assist in planning, prioritizing, developing and communicating updates to key transformation initiatives related Data & Analytics.

The ideal candidate will also possess knowledge of standard business processes related to distribution and fulfillment processes. This individual will assist identifying and developing KPIs for all our North America operations. They will manage priorities with the business, take on large projects themselves.

Leading cross-functional projects that drive new analytical capabilities through data-driven decision-making processes & outcomes.

Oversee the collection, processing, and analysis of logistics data across various cloud platforms, ensuring data security, compliance, and accessibility.

Utilizing cloud-based analytics and predictive modeling to identify trends, while optimizing logistic operational capabilities.

In partnership with leadership, evaluate and implement the latest analytics tools and technologies, prioritizing cloud-based solutions that offer scalability, reliability, and real-time data processing capabilities.

Act as core liaison between the Global Logistics function and other business units, ensuring alignment on analytical strategic initiatives.

Drive the innovation and integration of cloud technology solutions within the logistics and supply chain functions, ensuring they are leveraged to their full potential for analytics and decision-making.

Skills:

Communication and analytical skills, sql, python, data visualization, cloud, azure, power bi, microstrategy, sap erp, wms

Top Skills Details:

Communication and analytical skills, sql, python, data visualization, cloud

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Supply Chain Management or Engineering

Relevant work experience related to Supply Chain, Distribution, Transportation or IT

Highly proficient with cloud based analytical platform implementations & capabilities (i.e Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform)

Advanced skillset in driving complex solutioning & delivery of reporting & analytics solutions through scalable automation

Highly proficient SQL & Python knowledge with demonstrated use of common BI Visualization Platforms such as Qlik Sense, MicroStrategy, Tableau, Power BI, or similar reporting tools

Demonstrated skillset leveraging cloud-based integration technologies for ETL/ELT process & transformation

Working knowledge of modern cloud-based solution architecture data platform concepts

Excellent project management skills (including prioritization and organization) with ability to influence key business stakeholders to drive positive outcomes

Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, WMS, relational databases and ERP systems (e.g. SAP)

This individual must be open to working W2 and a hybrid schedule in Greensboro, NC*

About TEKsystems:

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. Continuous Improvements Logistics Analyst

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

Ensuring alignment on analytical strategic initiatives
